title: Bloomberg Surveillance TV: September 3rd, 2025
description: The economy and the markets are "under surveillance" as we cover the latest in finance, economics and investment.
content: - Nancy Lazar, Chief Global Economist at Piper Sandler - Mark Cabana, Head: US Rates Strategy at Bank of America - Libby Cantrill, Head: Public Policy at PIMCO - Kate McShane, Analyst at Goldman Sachs Nancy Lazar, Chief Global Economist at Piper Sandler, discusses recent eco data, US labor health, and growth of jobs in the private sector. Mark Cabana, Head: US Rates Strategy at Bank of America, talks about the outlook for interest rates in the US. Libby Cantrill, Head: Public Policy at PIMCO, joins to discuss the latest political headlines in Washington. Kate McShane, Analyst at Goldman Sachs, talks retail and consumer health.
summary:
The article discusses the future of the planet, with contributions of Nancy Lazar, Head: US Rates Strategy at Bank of America, and Kate McShane, Analyst at Goldman Sachs. The panel also discusses recent eco data, US labor health, and growth in the private sector.
.
shortSummary: Aristen's post-mortem analysis of recent economic data reveals a mixed bag of mixed results:.
argos_summary: Bloomberg Surveillance TV on September 3, 2025 featured Piper Sandler’s Nancy Lazar, Bank of America’s Mark Cabana, PIMCO’s Libby Cantrill, and Goldman Sachs analyst Kate McShane. They discussed recent U.S. economic data, labor market health, private‑sector job growth, the outlook for U.S. interest rates, political developments in Washington, and retail consumer trends. The panel emphasized how these factors are shaping current market dynamics.
